Coding - Google C++

  • Introduction
  • Common rules

  1. Introduction

    Rules keep things restricted but easy.

    Coding convention lets program be easy to read and maintain.

    Google C++ Style Guide

    Checking script

    cpplint.py run #./cpplint.py *.h *.cc

    ./cpplint.py --linelength=500 *.cc #modify the restriction

  2. Common Rules

    NameDoDo not do
    header file suffix.h.hpp
    Source file suffix.cc.cpp
    indentation2 spaces1 tab

    NameDoCommon
    No Spaceend of a lineA line cannot end with a space, e.g int a = 1;[space]
    Spaceafter comma, before {, after //
    #define Guard#define PROJECT_PATH_FILE_H_No leading _, every .h should have one
    length of a line<= 80 characters./cpplint.py --linelength=500 *.cc

    Examples

    /**
 * Copyright 2018 Nan Qin
 */
#include <iostream>
// comments                                                     // a (at least one) space after //
int main() {                                                    // a (at least one) space before {
  for (int i= 0; i < 5; i++) {                                      // a (at least one) space between for and (, after ;
    int a =(1+1);                                                     // no space need after =
    std::cout <<"qinnan" << std::endl;                             // cannot use namespace 
  }
  return 0;
}
